head.supplied: C. of E. Grammar School, Geelong ¶ June 29th 1894. ¶ Charles A. Topp Esq ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ I have the honor to acknowledge your letter of the 25th instant. In reply I accept with gratification and pleasure ...

div.p: From J. Bracebridge Wilson to Charles Topp
Y94/4566, unit 784, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

p.seg: C. of E. Grammar School, Geelong

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

div.p: I have the honor to acknowledge your letter of the 25th instant. In reply I accept with gratification and pleasure the valuable gift of Baron von Mueller's works. I beg that you will convey to the Chief Secretary my most cordial expression of thanks for his kind and generous appreciation of the small services I have been able to render to the Botanical Department. I had not the least expectation of any such return, or even of notice — My sole object has been to strengthen as far as lay in my power the hands of our Government Botanist, who stands in the first rank among the scientific men of the day —
I feel that his position here confers distinction on the colony in the eyes of men of culture throughout the world —

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be
